DOC.HEAD: Plane Trying to Tow Banner Crashes, Killing Pilot
Eds: SUBS 4th graf, `The pilot ...,' to UPDATE with pilot's identity.
DOC.TEXT: A small airplane that tried to hoist a banner aloft from an airport and fly it over a professional football game crashed Sunday, killing the pilot, a police official said. The Cessna 182 took off from Lunken Airport and had swooped back over the airport low enough to hook a banner suspended between two poles when the accident occurred around 1:30 p.m., said police traffic officer Dan Katt. The plane lost power when it hooked the banner, Katt said. The pilot quickly dropped the banner and tried to glide back toward the runway for a crash landing, but clipped the top of a helicopter which had just landed on a taxiway, he said. The pilot _ Robert Jeff Ott, 26, of Batavia _ was taken to University Hospital in Cincinnati where he died, Katt said. Bobby Leach, a traffic reporter for radio station WKRC in Cincinnati who was in the helicopter, was treated and released for minor injuries at Mercy Hospital, Katt said. The helicopter pilot was not hurt, the officer said. The plane was attempting to carry the banner over Riverfront Stadium for a game between the Cincinnati Bengals and the Houston Oilers. Katt said he did not know the size of the banner.
